original: IBM  ( International Business Machines  Corporation) is an American multinational innovation organization headquartered in Armonk, New York, United States, with activities in more than 170 nations. The organization started in 1911 as the Computing-Tabulating-Recording Company (CTR) and was renamed "Universal Business Machines" in 1924.
result: IBM, an American multinational technology company, has its headquarters in Armonk, New York and operates in over 170 countries worldwide. It was first established in 1911 as the Computing-Tabulating-Recording Company (CTR) and then changed its name to "International Business Machines" in 1924.

original: Nicknamed Big Blue, IBM is one of 30 organizations incorporated into the Dow Jones Industrial Average and one of the world's biggest bosses, with (starting at 2017) more than 380,000 representatives. Known as "IBMers", IBM representatives have been granted five Nobel Prizes, six Turing Awards, ten National Medals of Technology and five National Medals of Science.
result: IBM, also known as Big Blue, is a multinational technology corporation that is listed on the Dow Jones Industrial Average and is one of the largest employers in the world with over 380,000 employees (as of 2017). IBMers, as its employees are called, have been awarded numerous accolades, including five Nobel Prizes, six Turing Awards, ten National Medals of Technology, and five National Medals of Science.

original: IBM India's Solution and Services span all major industries including Financial Services, healthcare, government automotive, telecommunication, and education amongst others.IBM holds numerous awards for its industry-leading employment practices and policies.

The company has a proven track record of excellence and has received numerous accolades for its employment practices and policies.

result: The concept of mutual exclusion signifies that when multiple processes are utilizing the same variable, other processes must wait until the process in the critical section completes its execution. Once the process in the critical section is completed, it notifies the other processes that they can enter the critical section.

original: Synchronization is the procedure by which Data Protection Manager (DPM) exchanges information changes from an ensured record server to a DPM server, and afterward applies the progressions to the copy of the secured information. DPM depends on synchronization to keep imitations synchronized with the ensured information on the document servers.
result: Synchronization is a crucial process in Data Protection Manager (DPM) that involves transferring updated information from a protected file server to a DPM server, and subsequently applying these changes to the duplicate of the protected data. This enables DPM to ensure that the replicas of the protected data are up-to-date and consistent with the source data on the file servers.

original: Virtual memory is a memory administration capacity of an OS that utilizes equipment and programming to enable a PC to make up for physical memory deficiencies by briefly exchanging information from irregular access memory (RAM) to plate stockpiling.
result: Virtual memory is a feature in an operating system that allows a computer to compensate for shortage of physical memory. It works by temporarily transferring data from random access memory (RAM) to disk storage using both hardware and software.

original: In PC working frameworks, paging is a memory administration by which, computer stores and recovers information from secondary storage for use in main memory. In this scheme, the operating system retrieves data from secondary storage in same-size blocks called paging.
result: In computer operating systems, paging is a technique used to manage memory. It involves the retrieval of data from secondary storage in standardized blocks called "pages" for use in main memory. This system enables the operating system to efficiently store and access data.

original: Faulting:  A page fault (now and then called #PF, PF or hard fault) is a sort of special case raised by PC equipment when a running system gets to a memory page that isn't right now mapped by the memory administration unit (MMU) into the virtual address space of a procedure.
result: A page fault, also referred to as PF, hard fault, or #PF, is a type of exception that occurs when a program attempts to access a memory page that is currently not mapped by the memory management unit (MMU) into the virtual address space of the process. This exception is raised by computer hardware and indicates that the requested page is not in physical memory.

original: Deadlock:  A deadlock is a situation in which two computer programs sharing the same resource are effectively preventing each other from accessing the resource, resulting in both programs ceasing to function. The earliest computer operating systems ran only one program at a time procedure.
result: A deadlock occurs when two software programs need to access the same resource but end up blocking each other's access, causing both programs to stop functioning. Initially, computer operating systems could only run one program at a time.

original: a += a+ (++a) is the same as a = a + a + (++a) First thing that happens is that a++ will set a to 21, after that it will calculate: a = a + a + a; 21 + 21 + 21 = 63 so the result is 63.
result:
Sure, here's an attempt:
    
When executing the statement "a += a+ (++a)", the value of "a" is first incremented by one due to "++a". After that, the statement evaluates to "a = a + a + (++a)". So, "a" is updated to 21, and then the statement calculates the sum of "a + a + a", resulting in 63.

original: The procedure planning is the action of the procedure director that handles the expulsion of the running procedure from the CPU and the determination of another procedure based on a specific methodology.
result: Procedure planning refers to the process undertaken by a procedure manager to remove an ongoing process from the CPU and select an alternative procedure using a particular methodology.

original: Process planning is a fundamental piece of Multiprogramming working frameworks. Such working frameworks enable in excess of one procedure to be stacked into the executable memory at once and the stacked procedure shares the CPU utilizing time multiplexing.
result: Multiprogramming operating systems rely on process planning as a key component. With these systems, several processes can be simultaneously loaded into executable memory, and the CPU is shared via time multiplexing among the loaded processes.

original: Derivation (C++ only) Inheritance is implemented in C++ through the mechanism of derivation. Derivation allows you to derive a class, called a derived class, from another class, called a base class. In the declaration of a derived class, you list the base classes of the derived class.
result: In C++, inheritance is implemented using derivation. With derivation, a derived class is created by extending a base class. When defining a derived class, you specify the base class from which it derives.

original: The most frequent use of inheritance is for deriving classes using existing classes, which provides reusability. The existing classes remain unaltered. By reusability, the development time of software is reduced. The derived classes extend the properties of base classes to generate more dominant objects.
result: Inheritance is commonly utilized to create new classes based on existing ones, allowing for the reuse of code and reducing development time. This inheritance process does not change the original classes themselves. By extending the properties of base classes, derived classes can generate more complex objects with enhanced functionality.

original: Procedural programming is a programming paradigm that uses a linear or top-down approach. It relies on procedures or subroutines to perform computations.
result: Procedural programming is a methodology in programming which follows a linear or step-by-step process. This technique employs the use of subroutines or procedures to carry out specific tasks or calculations.

original: Procedural programming is also known as imperative programming.
result: The term procedural programming is synonymous with imperative programming.

original: A passage control circle checks the condition at the season of the section and if condition or articulation turns out to be genuine at that point control moves into the body of the circle. Such kind of circle controls passage to the circle that is the reason it is called the section control circle.
result: A section control loop is designed to monitor the state of a system at the time of entry. If the condition or expression is true, the control is transferred to the body of the loop. This loop controls entry to the loop, hence the name section control loop.

original: A scope is a region of the program and broadly speaking there are three places, where variables can be declared ? Inside a function or a block which is called local variables. In the definition of function parameters which is called formal parameters. Outside of all functions which are called global variables.
result: A programming term, 'scope', refers to a specific area of a program where variables may be declared. Generally, there are three areas where variables can be declared: inside a function or block (known as local variables), within a function parameter definition (known as formal parameters), or outside of all functions (known as global variables).

original: Dangling else is a problem happens when we utilize settled if. ... Here in the above case we really need to give the else provision to the external most if condition however it is considered for the deepest if condition .this is called dangling else problem.
result: The issue of dangling else occurs when a nested if statement is used and the else clause is ambiguous as to which if statement it should be connected to. In the example given, the else clause needs to be connected to the outermost if statement, but it is instead attached to the innermost if statement, creating a dangling else problem.

original: Deadlock can exist if and only if 4 conditions hold simultaneously:
result: A deadlock will only occur when four particular conditions are satisfied simultaneously.

original: [p1, p2, ­, pn] such that p1 is waiting for p2, p2 for p3, and so on­.
result: One possible solution to the circular waiting problem in computing systems is to have a predetermined order of resources allocation. This means that each process waits for a specific resource to become available before it starts its execution. In this way, a circular waiting situation cannot occur, as each process is waiting for a specific resource, rather than waiting for another process to release a resource that it needs. Another approach is to use a technique called deadlock avoidance, involving a graph-based algorithm that detects and prevents cycles of waiting by imposing a total ordering on all resources. This ensures that no circular waiting situation can occur, as the resources are allocated in a pre-determined order.

original: An object-oriented database management system (OODBMS) is a database management system that supports the creation and modeling of data as objects. OODBMS also includes support for classes of objects and the inheritance of class properties and incorporates methods, subclasses, and their objects.
result: An OODBMS is a type of database management system that enables the creation and organization of data as objects, allowing for classes of objects with inherited properties, methods, and subclasses. It is designed to support object-oriented programming principles, making it more intuitive and flexible than traditional database systems.

original: Also called an object database management system (ODMS).
result: An ODMS, which stands for object database management system, is another term used for a type of database management system that is specifically designed to store and manage objects as data.

original: The reason for sudo is to execute the charge given to it with root benefits. The motivation behind su is to switch the present client setting. It is fundamentally an antecedent to sudo. On the off chance that no client name is determined for su, at that point it changes to root.
result: The purpose of using sudo is to execute a command with root privileges. On the other hand, su is used to switch the current user context. It is essentially a predecessor to sudo. When no specific username is specified for su, it switches to the root user account.

original: In programming, a string is a contiguous sequence of symbols or values, such as character strings (a sequence of characters)or a binary digits string(a string of binary values).
result: A string in programming refers to a series of values or symbols that are contiguous. It could be a character string, which is a sequence of characters, or a binary digits string, which is a string of binary values.

original: An array is a data structure that contains a group of elements. Regularly, these elements are of the same data type such as integer or string. Arrays are commonly used in the computer program to organized data so that a related set of values can be easily sorted or searched.
result: An array is a collection of data elements that are grouped together in a computer program. These elements often share the same data type, such as integers or strings. They are a fundamental data structure in programming, used to organize related values for efficient sorting and searching.

original: 1. it is a better and convenient way of storing data of the same data type with the same size.
result: Storing data of the same data type and size becomes more efficient and hassle-free when using arrays.

original: 2. It allows users to store a number of elements in it.
result: The data structure can hold multiple items in it, providing users with a means of storage for their data.

original: Click here for:  HR Interview Questions and Answers
result:
Here's a rephrased version of the content to avoid plagiarism:

To avoid committing plagiarism, it's important to rephrase content instead of copying it word-for-word. Instead of copying and pasting, try to understand the main idea of the content and express it in a different way that's unique to you. This helps to avoid copyright infringement and ensures that you're not passing off someone else's work as your own. Always cite your sources when using outside information and give credit where credit is due. By taking these precautions, you can ensure that your work is original and ethical.
